text: The Norweigan College of Fishery Science or NCFS (Norweigan: ) is a school in Norway that teaches people about fish and how to manage fishing. It started in 1972 and is part of the University of Tromsø. In 1988, it changed and became its own part of the university. NCFS helps people learn about fish and how to take care of them. They also teach people how to work in the fishing industry. In 2004, NCFS started a new part called MaReMa Centre. This part helps people learn more about fish and how to manage the areas around where fish live. == References == Category:Education in Norway Category:Buildings and structures in Tromsø
title: Norwegian College of Fishery Science
